title: My 3 year old and his whole preschool class love it!
text: It is great!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2020
name: Treeartist
title: Not for preschoolers still learning the alphabet.
text: My preschool aged grandson is too young for this. I was excited by the thought that he would become familiar with the alphabet in a fun way, but he’s still too young. He doesn’t get that he should use the magnetic pencil to trace the letters. He treats the board like a noisemaker and shakes it and tries pushing the magnetic beads in with his fingers. I’ve even caught him jumping up and down on it to make it rattle and surprisingly, it held up quite well under that kind of abuse. Not a single scratch or bend or crack it it. He’s too young to write and the magnetic pencil is short and stubby unlike a real pencil. Once my grandson learns to write he will understand he can follow the arrows to trace the letters. Save this for when you have time to sit with your child and teach them how to use it as a tool.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2020
name: Christine Walker
title: Hard to use
text: It’s very hard for a child to use.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020
name: Mrs Rose
title: Great product that grows with your littles
text: I LOVE this product. My 3 year old is just starting to learn letters and he loves playing with it. My 1.5 year old also loves it! It’s a fun, interactive way to begin letter recognition; and I can tell it will definitely be used as he gets older to learn to write. They got it for Christmas and I’m amazed that they still pull it out. That’s what prompted me to write this review!!It’s definitely worth the money and I even find it fun to play with.The ONLY complaint I have, like other reviewers, is that the pen is not connected to the board, and it will be easily lost. I really wish there was a way to connect it, but I still couldn’t take off a star for that because I still love it so much.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020
name: Katrina Langland
title: It’s a hit!
text: I honestly was afraid this may be another toy I would get, thinking my daughter would enjoy for her to play with it a few times and get bored of it. But she absolutely loves it! She’s been taking it everywhere and practicing the letters (even in the car she’ll see a letter in a sign and practice “writing” it on this). Totally recommend it!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2020

name: LuckyDog
title: Very engaging
text: My 2 1/2 year old son really enjoys this magnet letter board. I needed something that would spark his interest in learning his letters and this board has helped a lot! He will sit down and play with it for at least 15 minutes at a time. When he gets a little older it will be really helpful for him to learn to write each letter.It is a little bulky in size for everyday travel. I took it with me to entertain my son while I had lunch with a friend. It certainly did it's job as he sat quietly playing with it, but it took a lot of space in my bag and just added weight while we shopped after we ate. Very minor, but really my only dislike about the product. I would definitely take it on an airplane trip or a long car ride.

name: jenny
title: Great educational toy
text: This is an awesome"toy" to help kids improve their handwriting. The magnetic balls move up towards the surface as you bring the pen across.If you go too fast, the balls don't come up right, so it forces slower, more deliberate movements.It has numbered arrows to help with the proper order and direction of the strokes. My son loves this toy, and I think it has definitely helped his handwriting.

text: My son likes it, but it’s super hard for tiny hands to drag the pen across the board since the magnet is stronger. So he basically can’t draw the letters he only connects the dots one at a time because it’s difficult for him. Also, the ink that is used for the letters is starting to smear. We’ve only had it two days and it’s starting to smear everywhere all over his fingers and I’m worried that the letters will rub off all together. We also got it about 4 days later than expected which was super annoying & the package was super smashed up. The product works okay, but not worth $20. All in all, it’s just okay.

He has asked to play with handwriting so many times since it has arrived. When he use to whine practice writting.Great for just starting to learn to write or those having trouble with corrections on letter formation.

name: Kiara Weyrick
title: Classroom use
text: I bought this for my Kindergarten classroom to help some of my struggling students with their letter recognition and it has truly been a game changer. If anything, I need to buy a second one. My struggling students or wiggly students like to use it when they are getting distracted and the rest of my class want to play with it because it is new!!! I feel like all of my students can benefit from this board. I can honestly say this is one of the best purchases I have ever made for my classroom.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
name: Nurse practitioner by day - mommy by night
title: Could be better...
text: I like the concept of this item, but there are a few flaws. You have to trace over the letters several times to get all the balls to “stick” which kind of defeats the purpose of tracing the letter if you have to go back over just certain areas of the letter. The pencil also needs a string attaching it to the board. Please tell me what 4 year old is going to keep track of a pencil in a sea of toys 🤦🏻‍♀️

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2019
name: Shannan Shaw
title: Not what I intended
text: The board itself works great, but the letters are lowercase!There was no indication when I was ordering that this would be a possibility, and even the box shows uppercase!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2019
name: Amazon Customer
title: Received lower case, thought they would be upper case.
text: The packaging is deceiving, I thought this product would be uppercase letters but it lowercase. The magnets are difficult to maneuver, especially for a toddler.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2019
name: Celina Kilgore
title: Magnetic Drawing board Alphabet
text: I bought this for my four year old grandson.He really loved it.My only criticism is that there is only one'magnetic pen' and it is not attached to the board.Once it is separated and lost, the board is not effective for use.It would be nice to have a second pen or have one attached so little one can enjoy it for a longer period of time.Overall, though, it is a great learning tool!

name: Nancy Matthews
title: Great Learning Tool
text: Both my 6-yr-old son and 5 yr-old-son love this board. They love the sound that each little ball bearing makes when the pop up using the magnetic pencil.They also love pushing the balls back down. I like doing that too and enthusiastically say, "POP!" to make my boys laugh.The magnetic pencil is not attached to the board and ours has gone missing on several occasions. It would be nice if it were attached with a long cord.
